abstract: Genzyme‘s stock fell slightly Thursday after the biotech company’s chief executive, Henri Termeer, said he had no interest in selling the company, despite speculation that billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn, who owns stock in the company, could push it to find a buyer.
lead_paragraph: Genzyme‘s stock fell slightly Thursday after the biotech company’s chief executive, Henri Termeer, said he had no interest in selling the company, despite speculation that billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn, who owns stock in the company, could push it to find a buyer.
